message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.GT, cs.SY. 

The paper deals with multi-armed bandit problems, which are a common topic in machine learning and optimization. The use of combinatorial structures in the proposed algorithms suggests that the paper may belong to the cs.LG (Machine Learning) or cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) sub-categories. The analysis of regret lower bounds and scaling with decision space dimension suggests that the paper may also belong to the cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) sub-category. The use of adversarial settings suggests that the paper may belong to the cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory) or cs.SY (Systems and Control) sub-categories.
